frame.name: FR_Cognizer_affecting.veracity
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Cognizer</fen> comes to accept some mental <fen>Content</fen> as true, either because of some <fen>Evidence</fen>, or because of a <fen>Persuader</fen> who expresses, through language or otherwise, their wish to get the <fen>Cognizer</fen> to change their mind. <ex><fex name="Evidence">The divorce</fex> <t>convinced</t> <fex name="Cognizer">him</fex> <fex name="Content">that marriage was not for him</fex>.</ex>
<ex></ex> <asf>Distinctions with other frames</asf>: <ex></ex>
≠ <frframe>FR_Attempt_suasion.veracity</frframe>: In FR_Cognizer_affecting.veracity, the <fen>Cognizer</fen> actually changes his mind.
<ex></ex> ≠ <frframe>FR_Becoming_aware</frframe>: FR_Becoming_aware's LUs do not imply that the Cognizer's stance on the Content was based on anything, whereas Coming_to_believe's LUs imply that either a person or a situation initiated the Cognizer's stance.
<ex></ex> ≠ <frframe>Coming_to_believe</frframe>: Coming_to_believe's Cognizer's stance cannot be initiated by a human volitional source, whereas FR_Cognizer_affecting.veracity's can.
<ex></ex> <asf>Relation to fndata-1.5</asf> : Results from the merge of Suasion and Eventive_cognizer_affecting, and the splitting into .to_do, .veracity and .legitimacy, based on whether the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is convinced to perform an action or that some content is true or legitimate.</def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition: <def-root>The person whose mind the <fen>Persuader</fen> seeks to change.</def-root>

FE.name: Persuader
FE.definition: <def-root>The person who intends through the use of language or otherwise to get another person to accept the mental <fen>Content</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Content
FE.definition: <def-root>The new idea that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> accepts as a result of the <fen>Persuader</fen>'s words</def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root>A piece of written or spoken material that changes the mind of the <fen>Cognizer</fen>. <ex><fex name="Medium">His speech</fex> <t>convinced</t> me that joining the Peace Corps was the right thing to do.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Evidence
FE.definition:
<def-root>The state of affairs which motivates the <fen>Cognizer</fen> to change his/her mind.
<ex><fex name="Evidence">The accident</fex> <t>convinced</t> him that driving was dangerous.</ex></def-root>
